Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] heritrix embed issue
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281; y=kC6tsO5d8uyMpygtDjGDYV7yTrY91_CemtjtW4bJU9wmXh7KXff7rkWy

Yes.  The Heritrix jar has overlays for classes in commons-pool and 
commons-httpclient (Bug fixes submitted back to commons yet to be 
integrated and inserting ourselves where the API does not allow).  In 
standalone mode, as long as the heritrix.jar gets loaded first, its 
usually not a problem.  Having the heritrix jar load first is hard to 
guarantee in containers. 

Looking at the tomcat classloader page, its says: "When a request to 
load a class from the web application's /WebappX/ class loader is 
processed, this class loader will look in the local repositories 
*first*, instead of delegating before looking." 
(http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.0-doc/class-loader-howto.html).   Do 
things work if you move the commons pool and httpclient libs up into the 
tomcat common directory?  If so, I'll  stop building these libs into the 
WAR file and amend heritrix-as-WAR instructions.

Thanks for persevering and for keeping list up on your travails.
St.Ack


Laurian Gridinoc wrote:
>
> SOLVED.
>
> I just noticed that you provide your own modifications for
> commons.pool and httpclient in heritrix.jar, I removed the equivalent
> classes from the pool and httpclient jars, so no more issues.
>
> Cheers,
> -- 
> Laurian Gridinoc, purl.org/net/laur
>
>
